ARABIC: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِم بِٱلْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْـَٔرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But then when We seize the affluent among them with the punishment, they will suddenly start praying fervently.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So that when We seize the affluent among them with affliction, they will begin to implore for help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: But when We will strike with torment those (unbelievers) who are rich, they will start to cry for help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To the extent that when We seized the wealthy among them with punishment, they immediately began imploring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Until when We seize those of them who lead a luxurious life with punishment; behold, they make humble invocation with a loud voice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Until when We overtake those who lead easy lives among them with punishment, lo! they cry for succor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Till, when We seize with the chastisement the ones of them that live at ease, behold, they groan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they supplicate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But then when We seize the affluent among them, they will cry out for help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Until when We lay hold of the luxuriant ones of them with the torment, and lo! then they are imploring!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When We seize their affluent ones with punishment, behold, they make entreaties [to Us].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Until, when We seize in Punishment those of them who received the good things of this world, behold, they will groan in supplication!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Until, when We grasp those of them who lead a luxurious life with punishment, behold! They make humble invocation with a loud voice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But when We seize with the punishment those of them that live in ease, they groan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Until, when We seize the decadent among them with torment, they begin to groan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:64] Indeed (hattā is for inceptiveness) when We seize their affluent ones, their wealthy and their leaders, with chastisement, [with] the sword, on the day of Badr, behold! they are supplicating loudly, clamouring [in supplication]. It is [then] said to them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Till when We grasp their luxurious ones) their tyrants and leaders: Abu Jahl Ibn Hisham, al-Walid Ibn al- Mughirah al-Makhzumi, al-'As Ibn Wa'il al-Sahmi, 'Utbah and Shaybah and their friends (with the punishment) with hunger for seven years, (behold! they supplicate) they plead.
